item.title: [DISTRELEC-6322] EE Q // Key correction - add to cart button

Please test after the next deployment
Thanks
Please test today, thx.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6551] ELFA Roll Out // Add LV-RU to FF
item.description:
LV-RU is missing.
Please add the Fact Finder channel Latvia - Russian (LV-RU) to Q and P.
item.summary: ELFA Roll Out // Add LV-RU to FF

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: The export jobs for attribute and unit are succeeded. But the main export job (distrelec_7810_lv_ru_export) is crashing without any error in the log. Have to further analyze... 20150313-distrelec_7810_lv_ru_export-crash.png

Reason why job fails:

13 Mar 2015 20:56:52 ERROR [distrelec_7810_lv_ru_export::de.hybris.platform.servicelayer.internal.jalo.ServicelayerJob] (distrelec_7810_lv_ru_export) [DistFactFinderExportJob] Failed exporting factfinder data for channel distrelec_Q_7810_lv_ru
com.namics.distrelec.b2b.core.inout.export.exception.DistFlexibleSearchExecutionException: Could not execute FlexibleSearch statement
        at com.namics.distrelec.b2b.core.inout.export.impl.DistDefaultFlexibleSearchExecutionService.execute(DistDefaultFlexibleSearchExecutionService.java:56)
        at com.namics.distrelec.b2b.core.inout.export.impl.DistDefaultCsvTransformationService.transform(DistDefaultCsvTransformationService.java:54)
        at com.namics.hybris.ffsearch.export.DistFactFinderExportJob.exportChannel(DistFactFinderExportJob.java:77)
        at com.namics.hybris.ffsearch.export.DistFactFinderExportJob.perform(DistFactFinderExportJob.java:66)
        at com.namics.hybris.ffsearch.export.DistFactFinderExportJob.perform(DistFactFinderExportJob.java:1)
        at de.hybris.platform.servicelayer.internal.jalo.ServicelayerJob.performCronJob(ServicelayerJob.java:40)
        at de.hybris.platform.cronjob.jalo.Job.execute(Job.java:1294)
        at de.hybris.platform.cronjob.jalo.Job.performImpl(Job.java:813)
        at de.hybris.platform.cronjob.jalo.Job.access$1(Job.java:772)
        at de.hybris.platform.cronjob.jalo.Job$JobRunable.run(Job.java:677)
        at de.hybris.platform.util.threadpool.PoolableThread.run(PoolableThread.java:198)
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: ORA-01489: result of string concatenation is too long

        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:445)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:396)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.processError(T4C8Oall.java:879)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.receive(T4CTTIfun.java:450)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.doRPC(T4CTTIfun.java:192)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.doOALL(T4C8Oall.java:531)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.doOall8(T4CPreparedStatement.java:207)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.executeForDescribe(T4CPreparedStatement.java:884)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.executeMaybeDescribe(OracleStatement.java:1167)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.doExecuteWithTimeout(OracleStatement.java:1289)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeInternal(OraclePreparedStatement.java:3584)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeQuery(OraclePreparedStatement.java:3628)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatementWrapper.executeQuery(OraclePreparedStatementWrapper.java:1493)
        at de.hybris.platform.jdbcwrapper.PreparedStatementImpl.executeQuery(PreparedStatementImpl.java:194)
        at com.namics.distrelec.b2b.core.inout.export.impl.DistDefaultFlexibleSearchExecutionService.execute(DistDefaultFlexibleSearchExecutionService.java:54)
        ... 10 more
13 Mar 2015 20:56:52 INFO  [distrelec_7810_lv_ru_export::de.hybris.platform.servicelayer.internal.jalo.ServicelayerJob] (distrelec_7810_lv_ru_export) [DistFactFinderExportCronjob] Finished CronJob distrelec_7810_lv_ru_export (distff.factFinderExportJob)
Status: FINISHED
Result: FAILURE
Start:  Fri Mar 13 17:45:10 CET 2015
End:    Fri Mar 13 20:56:52 CET 2015
Status: Did not yet found the reason for the crash. It must be related to the language (ru) since the export for ee (distrelec_7790_ee_ru_export) fails, too.

Hi Adi

any news on this? thank you

Hi Oana. Already investigated 2 days and currently working on this. Sorry, still no "result"....

  • It must be related to ru content.
  • It's not related to product features.
  • It's not related to price data (neither price nor SingleMinPrice).
  • It's not related to category data.

Have to analyze all the other exported data like: mageURL, AdditionalImageURL, stock ....

Status update:
The problem is related to the SEO URL. The encoding of cyrillic characters for the URL enlarges the URL a lot.
Such an URL 

http://test.distrelec.ee/ru/Компьютеры-%26-Хобби

is written like this:
http://test.distrelec.ee/ru/%D0%9A%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%BF%D1%8C%D1%8E%D1%82%D0%B5%D1%80%D1%8B-%26-%D0%A5%D0%BE%D0%B1%D0%B1%D0%B8/c/cat-L1D_379523

Since we have the category + manufacturer + product name in the URL, it results in a too long string.

I have to talk to Pierre to find out how russian URL's can be shortened.
Ask Daniela: What exactly is the field CategoryExtensions in the FF export used for? (see categoryExtensions.xlsx)

Problem is during concatenation of the field "CategoryExtensions" that results in error ORA-01489: result of string concatenation is too long.

The following example will fail with the same error:

SELECT LPAD('x',4000,'x') || LPAD('x',4000,'x')  || LPAD('x',4000,'x') FROM DUAL;

Solution: Convert the first string to a CLOB and concatenate the rest.

SELECT TO_CLOB(LPAD('x',4000,'x')) || LPAD('x',4000,'x')  || LPAD('x',4000,'x') 
FROM DUAL;

FF exports in language ru now should work. The change I had to do most probably has a negative performance impact
Because of required encoding of cyrillic characters the ru CSV file is much larger than the others.

Please test. But testing has to wait until v3.2.15 is deployed and the ru FF export has been performed. I try to give an "OK for testing" in this ticket...

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6543] ELFA (Q) - direct order with old elfa numbers
item.description:
Direct-order functionality does not support old ELFA product numbers:
Example 175-59-959 but if we use 17559959 it is working!

Requirement
The direct-order functionality should be able to handle old ELFA product-numbers (only in ELFA-case).
item.summary: ELFA (Q) - direct order with old elfa numbers

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: High-level estimate: 2h
fixed.
Hi Nabil, it's not working yet, it suggests the correct item but it doesn't adds it directly when hitting enter or clicking the "add" button, while the elfa product number is still in the field.
Now it should be fixed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6131] Searchfilter 24h missing
item.description:
Daniela: "Wenn ein Filter (oder ein Wert) fehlt, dann hat FF in der Regel keine Daten – so auch hier. Im Feed sind ausschliesslich 0 und 1 vorhanden (s.u., 0 = not on stock, 1=7days, 2= on stock). Bitte prüfen warum wir nur diese Werte haben – und die 2 wieder erhältlich machen"

English: If a filter (or value) is missing, then FF has usually also no data - also in this case. In the Feed are only 0 and 1 present. (0 = not on stock, 1=7days, 2= on stock)
Please check why we only have only those values and make the "2" available again, thx.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Feedback from the FF meeting

1. Where is the issue? Hybris or FF? -> Rafael can you pls identify at least one or more products on P?
2. Then we will see if the problem is in hybris or FF
3. We can fix the problem when we know in which system the issue is

  • Check general availability logic with Florian
  • Stocklevels you find in the hmc under Inventory->Stocklevels

The issue is already present in the FF-Export. See attached screenshot - stock-status "2" is missing. Please check an actual factfinder export - there you'll find products and the corresponding stock-levels(0/1/2). Please check why we don't have stock-status "2" anymore in the export.

Hi Florian

I need the general information about the availability logic for this ticket. From hybris we export the "InStock"-status as 0 1 or 2. 2 is for 24 hours. The exported value depends on the stocklevel value. At the moment there is no value 2 exported from hybris for FF channel ch_de. But in the frontend we display 24 hours availability for some products. We need to change the frontend logic or the FF export query, to have the same logic for the each case (FE & FF). Lets discuss this shortly together.

This is the export query for the "InStock" value in FF:

            SELECT s.productpk, (CASE WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 128 THEN 2 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >=96 THEN 1 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 64 THEN 0 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 40 THEN 2 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 32 THEN 1 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 24 THEN 2 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >=16 THEN 0 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 8 THEN 2 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >=6 THEN 1 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 5 THEN 0 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 2 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS InStock
                FROM ({{
                    SELECT {p.pk} AS productpk, (CASE WHEN sum({sl.available}) > 0 THEN 128 ELSE 64 END) AS InStock
                        FROM {Product AS p JOIN StockLevel AS sl ON {p.code} = {sl.productCode}}
                    WHERE
                        (
                            {sl.warehouse} IN
                            ({{
                                SELECT {wh.pk}
                                    FROM {Warehouse AS wh
                                    JOIN CMSSite2WarehouseExclusiveFast AS rel ON {rel.target} = {wh.PK}
                                    JOIN CMSSite AS cms ON {cms.pk} = {rel.source} AND {cms.pk} = 8796093187112 }
                            }})
                        ) GROUP BY {p.pk}
                }}
                UNION ALL {{
                    SELECT {p.pk} AS productpk, (CASE WHEN sum({sl.available}) > 0 THEN 32 ELSE 16 END) AS InStock
                        FROM {Product AS p JOIN StockLevel AS sl ON {p.code} = {sl.productCode}}
                    WHERE
                        (
                            {sl.warehouse} IN
                            ({{
                                SELECT {wh.pk}
                                    FROM {Warehouse AS wh
                                    JOIN CMSSite2WarehouseExclusiveSlow AS rel ON {rel.target} = {wh.PK}
                                    JOIN CMSSite AS cms ON {cms.pk} = {rel.source} AND {cms.pk} = 8796093187112 }
                            }})
                        ) GROUP BY {p.pk}
                }}
                UNION ALL {{
                    SELECT {p.pk} AS productpk, (CASE WHEN sum({sl.available}) > 0 THEN 8 ELSE 4 END) AS InStock
                        FROM {Product AS p JOIN StockLevel AS sl ON {p.code} = {sl.productCode}}
                    WHERE
                        (
                            {sl.warehouse} IN
                            ({{
                                SELECT {wh.pk}
                                    FROM {Warehouse AS wh
                                    JOIN CMSSite2WarehouseFast AS relFast ON {relFast.target} = {wh.PK}
                                    JOIN CMSSite2WarehouseExternalFast AS relExtFast ON {relExtFast.target} = {wh.PK}
                                    JOIN CMSSite AS cms ON {cms.pk} = {relFast.source} AND {cms.pk} = {relExtFast.source} AND {cms.pk} = 8796093187112 }
                            }})
                        ) GROUP BY {p.pk}
                }}
                UNION ALL {{
                    SELECT {p.pk} AS productpk, (CASE WHEN sum({sl.available}) > 0 THEN 2 ELSE 1 END) AS InStock
                        FROM {Product AS p JOIN StockLevel AS sl ON {p.code} = {sl.productCode}}
                    WHERE
                        (
                            {sl.warehouse} IN
                            ({{
                                SELECT {wh.pk}
                                    FROM {Warehouse AS wh
                                    JOIN CMSSite2WarehouseSlow AS relSlow ON {relSlow.target} = {wh.PK}
                                    JOIN CMSSite2WarehouseExternalSlow AS relExtSlow ON {relExtSlow.target} = {wh.PK}
                                    JOIN CMSSite AS cms ON {cms.pk} = {relSlow.source} AND {cms.pk} = {relExtSlow.source} AND {cms.pk} = 8796093187112 }
                            }})
                        ) GROUP BY {p.pk}
                }}
                UNION ALL
                {{
                    SELECT {p.pk} AS productpk, 0 AS InStock
                        FROM {product AS p}
                }}) s
            GROUP BY s.productpk

Cheers
Will

Please check the FF export process.

Correct behaviour would be:
Not in stock = 0
External Warehouse = 1
in stock = 2

Today's situation:
Not in stock = 0
External Warehouse = 1
in stock = 1 --> NOT OK
Looks like the problem was introduced by DISTRELEC-5692. There, some wrong SQL join statements do not honor "fast warehouses" anymore.

Fixed bug in warehouse selection.
I did the fix in the following FF-Export queries only:

  • DistFactFinderProductExportQueryCreator (currently active)
  • DistFactFinderProductExportQueryCreatorV6DQ (most probably the upcomming version used with DQ)

Please test

  • on D as of tomorrow
  • on Q as soon as v3.2.13 is deployed on test
  • on P as soon as v3.2.13 is deployed on production

(also fixed the issue that some FF exports were running on node1 instead of node0)
@Rafael: Bug for only partially fixed in v3.2.13. I have found a second issue, that was preventing correct export of "InStock"=2. Sorry, but you have to test again in v3.2.15.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5984] Slot for FF campaigns on Product detail page
item.description:
In order to display FF campaigns (e.g. campaign information etc) on product detail pages, we need more slots for displaying them:

The idea is to have the following:

  • A slot for displaying Feedback text (text or HTML) from Feedback campaigns above the product details; several feedback texts should be displayed if there are several campaigns for the same product
  • A slot for displaying Feedback text (text or HTML) from Feedback campaigns below the recommendation slot; several feedback texts should be displayed if there are several campaigns for the same product
  • as many slots as needed for product carousels provided by FF (i.e. several product campaigns on product detail pages should be possible). Currently, only one campaign is displayed, see here: http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Laborkabel-%C3%B8-4-mm-rot-100-cm-0-75-mm%C2%B2-CAT-I-Multi-Contact-SML-100CM-RED/p/14022002?q=101010&page=1&origPos=1&origPageSize=10&simi=100.0

Example visualization attached.

As the feedback text contents can vary in height, the slots should adjust automatically (as they do today on the SERP).
item.summary: Slot for FF campaigns on Product detail page

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: This is mainly FE task
Please reassign to BE in order to have FF feedback & campaigns on the Product Detail Page.
Added actual FF integration overview of the product detail page
Backend logic is done as discussed. Ruben is gonna do the frontend stuff for the product detail page now, then we are done.

Please test after the next deployment
thanks
Please test today, thx.
Feedback texts do not work, resp. are not visible on product detail page.
